intro: Craterostigma angolense, commonly known as the Angola rockcress, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are often small and linear, while its flowers are white or pale yellow. Craterostigma angolense is known for its resilience and is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
